Question: Please select the required edition.
Explanation:
Security Edition (applicable only for On-Premises) is a bundle of Desktop Management, Mobile Device Management, Vulnerability Manager Plus, Browser Security Plus, Device Control Plus, Application Control Plus and Bitlocker Management functionalities altogether in a central console which supports managing endpoints in both LAN & WAN architecture.

UEM (Unified Endpoint Management) Edition is a bundle of Desktop Management, Mobile Device Management, Modern Management for Windows 10 & OS Deployment functionalities which supports managing endpoints in both LAN & WAN architecture. Kindly refer to the below link to know the edition of Mobile Device Manager Plus (MDM) bundled with Endpoint Central different edition https://pitstop.manageengine.com/portal/en/community/topic/mdm-will-no-longer-be-an-add-on-it-will-be-now-available-in-all-editions-of-endpoint-central

Enterprise Edition supports distributed architecture & is suitable for managing computers within LAN & over WAN.

Professional Edition is suitable for managing computers within LAN.

Question: Do you require Secured Gateway Service?
Explanation:
Applicable only for On-Premises Endpoint Central (all editions).

Secure Gateway Server is a component that will be exposed to the internet. This component acts as an intermediate between the managed roaming agents and the UEM Central Server. Refer the below link to know more about this in detail.

https://www.manageengine.com/products/desktop-central/secure-communication-of-mobile-users-using-forwarding-server.html

Question: Do you require Failover Service?
Explanation:
Applicable only for On-Premises Endpoint Central (all editions).

Fail Over Service is to configure UEM Central to run on High Availability. Refer the below link to know more about this in detail.

https://www.manageengine.com/products/desktop-central/failover-server.html

Question: Do you require the application to support Multi-Language?
Explanation:
Endpoint Central supports multiple languages. Refer the below link to know more about the Supported Languages.

https://www.manageengine.com/products/desktop-central/supported-languages.html

Question: Number of Endpoints to be managed
Explanation:
Applicable for On-Premise & On Cloud Endpoint Central , which is licensed based on number of Endpoints that include Computers (PC/Laptops/Desktops)  & Mobile Devices for Desktop Management, Mobile Device Management & Modern Management for Windows 10 and macOS devices (only with UEM edition)  so on.

This is a floating license. If 100 endpoints license is purchased, it can be used across the bundled modules.

Question: Number  of  Servers to be managed
Explanation: Applicable for all Editions. Licensed based on the number of  Servers for managing the functionalities like Patch Management, Software Deployment, etc.

Question: Number of Users required to access the application
Explanation:
Applicable for all Editions.

Licensed based on the number of users who need access to the application for managing the functionalities like Patch Management, Software Deployment, etc.

Question: Do you require OS Deployment add-on?
Do you require Endpoint Security add-on?
Explanation:
Applicable for Professional, Enterprise & UEM  edition of Endpoint Central (On-Premises Only).

Endpoint Security add-on is the bundle of:

Vulnerability Manager Plus,

Browser Security Plus,

Device Control Plus,

Application Control Plus and Bitlocker Management.

You have a choice to choose the Endpoint Security add-on to include all the security features in a single add-on or you can choose the required components individually.

Refer to the link below to know more about this add-on, which is licensed based on total number of workstations.

https://www.manageengine.com/products/desktop-central/endpoint-security-features.html

Yes.Question: Do you require Vulnerability Manager Plus?
Do you require Browser Security Plus?
Do you require Device Control Plus?
Do you require Application Control Plus?
